gurmukhi: rQ aUpir sXwm cVwie ky so sMig lY sB gop qhwN ko gey hY ] g√çwrnIXw su rhI gH mY ijn ky mn bIc su Sok Bey hY ]
transliteration: Rath Oopar(i) Syaam Chadhaae So San(i) Lai Sabh Gop Tahaan Ko Gad Hai|| Gvaarneeyaa Su Rahigrah Mai Jin Ke Man Beech Su Shok Bhae Hai||
translation: Taking all the gopas with him in chariots, Krishna left; the gopis remained within their homes and the suffering of their mind increased abundantly;

gurmukhi: TwF aufIkq goip jhwN iqh Taur ibKY doaU eysu Aey hY ] suMdr hY ss sy ijnky muK kMcn ky qn rUp Cey hY ]812]
transliteration: Thaadh Udeekat Gop(i) Jahaan Tih Thaur Bikhai Dooo Es(u) Ae Hai|| Soundar Hai Sas Se Jin-ke Moukh Kanchanndke Tan Roop Chhae Hai||812||
translation: The place where the gopis had gathered together and were waiting for Krishna, both the brothers, Krishna and Balram, went there; the faces of both the brothers were beautiful like moon and the bodies like gold.812.

gurmukhi: jb hI AkRUr ky sMg ikDO jmnw pY gey biRj lok sbY ] AkRUr hI icMq krI mn mY Aiq pwp krXo hmhUM su AbY ]
transliteration: Jah Hiakroor Ke San Kidhau Jamnaa Pai Gad Brij Lok Sabai|| Akroor Hichint Kariman Mai At(i) Paap Daryo Hamhoon Su Abai||
translation: When Akrur reached on the bank of Yamuna w3ith all the people, then seeing the love of all, Akrur repented in his mind; he thought that he had sinned profusely in taking away Krishna from that place;

gurmukhi: qb hI qj kY rQ bIc DsXo jl ky sMiDAw krby ko qbY ] ieh ko mir hY niRp kMs blI ju BeI ieh kI Aiq icMq jbY ]813]
transliteration: Tab Hitaj Kai Rath Beech Dhasyo Jal Ke Sandhiaa Karbe Ko Tabai|| Eh Ko Mar(i) Hai Nrip Kans Baliju Bhaieh Kiat(i) Chint Jabai||813||
translation: Thinking like this, he entered the river-water for sandhya prayer and got worried on reflecting that the mighty Kansa would then kill Krishna.813.

gurmukhi: nwq jbY AkRUr mn hir ko krXo ibcwr ] qb iqh ko jl mY qbY drSn dXo murwr ]814]
transliteration: Naat Jabai Akroor Man Har(i) Ko Daryo Bichaar|| Tah Tih Ko Jal Mai Tabai Darshan Dayo Muraar||814||
translation: While taking bath, when Akrur remembered Lored Krishna, then the Lord (Murari) manifested himself in real form.814.

gurmukhi: muMf hjwr Bujw mhsy ds SyS ky Awsn pY su ibrwjY ] pIq lsY pt ckR krY ijh ky kr BIqr nMdg CwjY ]
transliteration: Mounnd Hajaar Bhujaa Sahse Das Shesh Ke Aasan Pai Su Biraajai|| Peet Lasai Pat Chakra Darai Jih Ke Kar Bheetar Nandag Chhaadai||
translation: Akruru saw that Krishna, with thousands of heads and thousands of arms, was seated on the bed of Sheshanaga; he has worn the yellow garments and had the disc and sword in his hands;

gurmukhi: bIc qbY jmunw pRgtXo Pun swDin ky hrby fr kwjY ] jwko khXo sB hI jg hY ijh dyKq hI Gn swvn lwjY ]815]
transliteration: Beech Tabai Jamounnda Pragtyo Phoun Saadhan(i) Ke Harbe Dar Kaajai|| Jaako Kahyo Sabh Hijag Hai Jih Dekhat Highan Saavan Laajai||815||
translation: In the same form Krishna manifested himself to Akrur in Yamuna; Akrur saw that Krishna, the remover of the sorrows of the saints, has under his control the whole world and he has such brilliance that the coulds of Sawan are feeling shy.815.

gurmukhi: jl qy kF kY mn mY suK kY mQurw ko clXo mn AwnMd pweI ] Dwie gXo niRp ky pur mY hr mwrn kI n krI duicqweI ]
transliteration: Jal Te Kadh Kai Man Mai Soukh Kai Mathuraa Ko Chadyo Man Aanand Paaee|| Dhaae Gado Nrip Ke Pur Mai Har Maaran Kina Karidouchitaaee||
translation: Then Akrur, coming out of water and in great comfort, started towards Mathura; he ran to the palace of the king and he now had not fear of Krishna being killed;

gurmukhi: kwnH ko rUp inhwrn ko mQurw kI jurI sB Awn lukweI ] jwky kCU qn mY duKu hY hir dyKq hI soaU pwr prweI ]816]
transliteration: Kaahn Ko Roop Nihaaran Ko Mathuraa Kijurisabh Aan Loukaaijaake Kachhodh Tan Mai Doukh(u) Hai Har(i) Dekhat Hisooo Paar Paraaee||816||
translation: Seeing the beauty of Krishna, all the inhabitants of Mathura gathered together in order to have a look at him; the person, who had any slight ailment in his body, the same was removed on seeing Krishna.816.
